channel.title: Elsden, Chris on Chege's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Elsden, Chris on Chege's Blog

item.title: Experiments/Theories in Socioeconomics
item.description: Programmable Money South Korea’s COVID-19 stimulus payments were programmed to expire in Aug 2020, and could only be spent at qualifying shops. Australia’s cashless welfare card [currently in pilot stages] cannot be withdrawn as cash, nor used at alcohol, tobacco and gambling joints. Monzo, a UK-based digital-first mobile baking app, supports IFTTT recipes. This enables budgeting logic, “If I spend at KFC, then move $5 to my penalty pot”.
